page.title: 05CRANFIELD'S MAY DAY part 2
page.content: 1st was "The Circus" by the Path- finders. After the rosettes had been awarded,it was announced that the 1st Cranfield Guides had donated a shield for the winning float, and each year the winners name would be engraved upon it. The May Queen gave a speech declaring the May Fete open. Among the stalls were a palmist, a tea and coffee stall, a tombola, a brantub, a tin can alley, a jam jar jungle and a cake stall. At 3pm there was a dancing display performed by the{Cranfield Dancing School.}The age range of the dancers was from pre-school age to approximately 13 years. Very pleasant weather enabled the villagers of Cranfield _ especially the young _to enjoy this annual event.
